Crimes.Crime_Name: Making false statements to obtain immigration benefits
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in confirming the RPD's findings on credibility
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal from RPD decision to RAD, followed by judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found lacking credibility due to inconsistencies between visa application and refugee claim
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Relevant provisions related to false statements and misrepresentation in immigration applications
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection based on domestic violence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Discrepancies in applicant's statements across applications
Crimes.Application_Error: RAD failed to conduct independent analysis
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Case remanded for redetermination by a different RAD panel
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: RAD must independently assess evidence, not defer automatically
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: New evidence and discrepancies not adequately evaluated by RAD
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness in administrative review
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Improper deference to RPD without independent assessment
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility due to conflicting statements
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictions between visa and refugee claim forms
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide meaningful appeal process
Crimes.Document_Fraud: False or misleading information in immigration documents
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged RAD’s reliance on RPD findings
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of independent review by RAD
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to analyze new evidence or inconsistencies
